hero.title: Aizen
hero.subtitle: Bring order to your repos. Switch worktrees, not windows.
hero.requirements: Requires macOS 13.5 Ventura or later (Apple Silicon & Intel)

workspaces.title: Workspace Management
workspaces.desc: Organize repositories into color-coded workspaces. Group related projects together.

worktrees.title: Git Worktrees
worktrees.desc: Work on multiple branches simultaneously without switching contexts. Git LFS support included.

agents.title: Agents
agents.desc: Claude, Codex, Gemini, Kimi, and custom agents via ACP. Auto-install from NPM or GitHub.

terminal.title: Integrated Terminal
terminal.desc: GPU-accelerated terminal powered by libghostty. Split panes, multiple tabs, custom themes.

git.title: Git Operations
git.desc: Stage, commit, push, pull, merge branches. Full-window diff viewer with syntax highlighting.

voice.title: Voice Input
voice.desc: Talk to your agents with voice commands. Real-time transcription with waveform visualization.

fileBrowser.title: File Browser
fileBrowser.desc: Browse files with directory tree view. Fuzzy search, syntax highlighting, multi-tab editing.

webBrowser.title: Web Browser
webBrowser.desc: Embedded browser for documentation and previews. Multiple tabs with session persistence.

step1.title: Organize your repos
step1.desc: Group repositories into workspaces. Add repos, create worktrees for branches you're working on. Everything in one place.

step2.title: Switch worktrees, not windows
step2.desc: Each worktree has its own terminal, file browser, web browser, and chat session. Click to switch. Your context stays exactly where you left it.

step3.title: Work in parallel
step3.desc: Run agents on one branch while reviewing code on another. No stashing, no juggling windows. Just parallel work.

q1.question: What problem does Aizen solve?
q1.answer: Developers working on multiple branches typically juggle editor windows, terminal tabs, and browser windows. Aizen gives each worktree its own dedicated workspace — terminal, files, browser, agents — so you switch worktrees, not windows.

q2.question: What are Git worktrees?
q2.answer: Git worktrees let you check out multiple branches simultaneously in separate directories. Unlike stashing or switching branches, each worktree is independent. You can build one branch while editing another.

q3.question: How is this different from VS Code or other editors?
q3.answer: Editors focus on one project at a time. Aizen is built around worktrees — you manage multiple repos and branches in one window, each with its own terminal, browser, and agent session. It's a workspace for parallel development, not an editor.

q4.question: Which agents are supported?
q4.answer: Aizen supports Claude, Codex (OpenAI), Gemini, Kimi, and any custom agent compatible with the Agent Client Protocol (ACP). Agents can be auto-installed from NPM or GitHub.

q5.question: Is Aizen free?
q5.answer: Yes. Aizen is free and open source under the Apache 2.0 license.

q6.question: What are the requirements?
q6.answer: macOS 13.5 Ventura or later. Apple Silicon and Intel Macs supported.
